descriptionSet.description: Front hard cover of a "Sample" album, "Art Pictorial Calendars" by Avantika Prakashan, Kanpur. The album cover is 10" x 15" in size and shows an image of "Buddha" on it.

AVANTIKA PRANKASHAN Printers, Publishers, Diary & Calendars Manufacturors, JWALA PRASAD CONTRACTOR LAKE (?) Jwala Bhawan - GWALTOLI KANPUR.

titleSet.title: Cover of a sample album of Art Pictorial calendars

hra:item.hra:value: text-en: Art Pictorial CALENDARS IN 10'' x 15'' SIZE
text-en: AVANTIKA PRANKASHAN Printers, Publishers, Diary & Calendars Manufacturors, JWALA PRASAD CONTRACTOR LAKE (?) Jwala Bhawan - GWALTOLI KANPUR.
description-en: Front hard cover of a "Sample" album, "Art Pictorial Calendars" by Avantika Prakashan, Kanpur. The album cover is 10" x 15" in size and shows an image of "Buddha" on it. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Artists resided throughout the subcontinent and were identified and retained by the printers to create these images (with more and less intervention by the publishers, depending on the clout they exercised). The images were gathered up by the printing companies and then produced (sometimes in India, sometimes in Europe), after which they were dispersed back out through regional networks. Selection of which images to distribute took place at several steps along these marketing routes, but local purveyors most often offered a quite wide range of choices, so that all local market demands could be met. There was virtually no specialization (such as by caste or religion, or by theme, style, etc.) that would mark out artist, printer, or purveyor as everyone tried to meet diverse market needs. (Sandria B. Freitag) (gs)
